page.title: 03CARMUNNOCK VILLAGE
page.content:
Carmunnock is a very pretty little farming village about 15 miles from the centre of{Glasgow}.Anyone interested in{history}or{architecture} would really enjoy a visit.
Most of the houses are 18th century although Carmunnock's story dates as far back as{The Bronze Age}.
Carmunnock was made a{CONSERVATION {VILLAGE}in 1974, which is just as well because the huge sprawl of{Castlemilk} is less than a mile away.
It is funny to think that the first people to live in the{18th century} houses must have lived through{ {Covenanting}times and{Jacobite} uprisings!
